title: False Bottom (Seamus McCree)
features: Secrets have a life of their own.

Seamus McCree returns to his native Boston to bury his Uncle Mike, a retired Boston police captain, who has been murdered. Seamus has been named executor of the estate, which is easy enough for him to settle. But he soon learns
Uncle Mike has left a second, secret legacy
- and that triggers an earthquake's worth of problems.

Adding to his troubles, Uncle Mike's killer is now gunning for Seamus and his family, and the family does not agree how they should respond: Run and hide? Stay and fight? Hire their own killer?In this sixth book in the Seamus McCree series, he must find a path through a labyrinth of lies and secrets stemming from his father's death more than forty years earlier and resolve all of Uncle Mike's legacies before the killer strikes again.
Order your copy and join Seamus in his fight to save his family—from killers and from themselves.
description: Known as James Montgomery Jackson on his tax return (and to his mother whenever she was really upset with him). Jim calls the deep woods of Michigan's Upper Peninsula home. As James M. Jackson, he authors the SEAMUS McCREE SERIES, suspenseful thrillers with a financial crime twist. The series includes 6 novels, 2 novellas, and several short stories.Jim also authored a book on contract bridge,
One Trick at a Time: How to Start Winning at Bridge
, which was published by Master Point Press (2012). He has written numerous short stories and essays.You can find out more about Jim or sign up for his newsletter at his website, jamesmjackson.com.
